articles.title: An Arsenal coffee cup and more pain for under-pressure Frank
articles.summary: Spurs boss Thomas Frank under more pressure and scrutiny after holding Arsenal-branded cup before 3-2 defeat by Bournemouth that left side 14th in Premier League.

articles.title: A warrior touched by tragedy - Terry Yorath obituary
articles.summary: Former Wales captain and manager Terry Yorath, who has died aged 75, had a glittering career, but his life was deeply affected by two tragedies.

articles.title: Fletcher to take charge for FA Cup - but Man Utd problems far bigger
articles.summary: Darren Fletcher will remain in charge of Manchester United for their FA Cup match against Brighton - as the club battle problems that go far deeper than sorting out managerial uncertainty.

articles.title: Weekly sports quiz:  How many managers have Man Utd had since Ferguson?
articles.summary: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport over the past seven days?

articles.title: Brilliant Brazilian and defying the odds - Brentford's European charge
articles.summary: With four wins in five games, and a Brazilian striker banging in the goals, Brentford fans are dreaming of the Champions League.

articles.title: Wilson will have his 'pick of clubs' - MOTD's Murphy
articles.summary: Match of the Day's Danny Murphy analyses Fulham's Harry Wilson's current form and "intelligent" winning performance against Chelsea.

articles.title: Rumoured Solskjaer return to Man Utd 'seems ridiculous'
articles.summary: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Stephen Warnock look at who should take charge at Manchester United following Ruben Amorim's departure earlier this week.

articles.title: Szoboszlai: Arsenal aren't champions yet, you don't win it in January!
articles.summary: It is still too early to crown Arsenal Premier League champions, says Liverpool midfielder Dominik Szoboszlai ahead of the two sides meeting at the Emirates Stadium on Thursday night, live on <em...

articles.title: Newcastle score twice in stoppage time to win seven-goal thriller
articles.summary: Harvey Barnes scores twice as Newcastle come from behind to beat Leeds in a dramatic seven-goal thriller at St James' Park.

articles.title: Wilson goal helps Fulham beat 10-man Chelsea
articles.summary: New Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior watched from the stands as Harry Wilson's fine finish condemns his team to defeat by west London rivals Fulham at Craven Cottage.

articles.title: Palace hold on to deny Villa victory in hard‑fought draw
articles.summary: Title challengers Aston Villa miss a chance to close the gap on Arsenal to three points as Crystal Palace's injury-hit side earn a goalless draw at Selhurst Park.

articles.title: Former England boss Keegan diagnosed with cancer
articles.summary: Former England striker and manager Kevin Keegan has been diagnosed with cancer and is receiving treatment.

articles.title: Keane's actions not deliberate - Moyes on red card
articles.summary: Everton manager David Moyes was not happy with the decision for Michael Keane to be sent off as it was "not a deliberate action", but has no sympathy for Jack Grealish who received two quick yellow ca...

articles.title: Man Utd did more than enough to win - Fletcher
articles.summary: Manchester United Interim manager Darren Fletcher says they created enough chances to have beaten Burnley after their 2-2 draw at Turf Moor.

articles.title: Liverpool sign keeper who saved four England penalties
articles.summary: Liverpool sign Sweden goalkeeper Jennifer Falk on loan from BK Hacken for the rest of the season.

articles.title: Leeds and Wales legend Yorath dies aged 75
articles.summary: Terry Yorath, who won the league title with Leeds in 1974 and came close to guiding Wales to the 1994 World Cup finals, dies at the age of 75.
